doc.after: The French police officer Alphonse Bertillon was the first to apply the anthropological technique of anthropometry to law enforcement thereby creating an identification system based on physical measurements Before that time criminals could only be identified by name or photograph 19 20 Dissatisfied with the ad hoc methods used to identify captured criminals in France in the 1870s he began his work on developing a reliable system of anthropometrics for human classification 21
